newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila power project gets $167 mln loan syndicate.
newsitem.headline: Manila power project gets $167 mln loan syndicate.

text.p: Four financial institutions have received the mandate to jointly underwrite a loan syndication of $167 million to finance the Philippines' first hydroelectric plant, one of the underwriters ING Bank Manila said on Monday.
Other underwriters are AB Capital, SolidBank Corp and the Philippine National Bank.
The project involves the construction and operation of a 70-megawatt power plant in northern Philippines.
The project is being undertaken on a build-operate-transfer basis by Aboitiz Equity Ventures Inc, Pacific Hydro Transfield Inc of Australia and PacifiCorp of the United States.
ING assistant vice president for project finance, David Uy, said details of the loan syndication are yet to be finalised.
